title: Designing and Implementing RCTs in Timor-Leste

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of randomization in an RCT?
choices: To ensure equal sample sizes
To minimize researcher bias
To attribute differences between groups to the intervention
To reduce costs of the study
questions.answer: To attribute differences between groups to the intervention

questions.question: Which of the following is a unique challenge when conducting RCTs in Timor-Leste?
choices: High literacy rates
Linguistic homogeneity
Advanced infrastructure
Cultural and linguistic diversity
questions.answer: Cultural and linguistic diversity

questions.question: What is a power calculation used for in RCT design?
choices: To determine the budget for the study
To calculate the duration of the intervention
To estimate the required sample size
To measure the impact of the intervention
questions.answer: To estimate the required sample size

questions.question: Which randomization strategy might be more appropriate in Timor-Leste's context?
choices: Individual randomization
Cluster randomization
Stratified randomization
Block randomization
questions.answer: Cluster randomization

questions.question: Why might cluster randomization be preferred in Timor-Leste?
choices: It's cheaper to implement
It allows for larger sample sizes
It helps minimize spillover effects
It's easier to explain to participants
questions.answer: It helps minimize spillover effects

questions.question: What is a key ethical consideration when conducting RCTs in Timor-Leste?
choices: Maximizing profit from the research
Obtaining informed consent from participants
Excluding local researchers from the study
Withholding results from the community
questions.answer: Obtaining informed consent from participants

questions.question: How can researchers address language barriers in Timor-Leste?
choices: Only include English-speaking participants
Use only written surveys
Work with local translators and enumerators
Conduct all interviews in Tetum
questions.answer: Work with local translators and enumerators

questions.question: What is a potential challenge of using control groups in Timor-Leste?
choices: Control groups are not necessary in RCTs
It may be seen as withholding benefits from a high-poverty population
Control groups are illegal in Timor-Leste
Control groups always receive better treatment
questions.answer: It may be seen as withholding benefits from a high-poverty population

questions.question: How can researchers ensure equitable resource allocation in RCTs?
choices: By only selecting wealthy participants
By implementing phase-in designs
By excluding control groups
By providing all benefits upfront
questions.answer: By implementing phase-in designs

questions.question: Why is community engagement important in RCTs in Timor-Leste?
choices: It's required by law
It increases the cost of the study
It improves the quality and relevance of the research
It allows researchers to avoid local customs
questions.answer: It improves the quality and relevance of the research

questions.question: What is a spillover effect in the context of RCTs?
choices: When the intervention affects the control group indirectly
When the study budget is exceeded
When participants drop out of the study
When researchers influence the results
questions.answer: When the intervention affects the control group indirectly

questions.question: What is the purpose of a baseline survey in an RCT?
choices: To determine the final impact of the intervention
To collect data on participants before the intervention
To select which participants will be in the control group
To decide on the research question
questions.answer: To collect data on participants before the intervention

questions.question: What does attrition refer to in RCTs?
choices: The process of selecting participants
The loss of participants from the study over time
The method of randomization
The analysis of results
questions.answer: The loss of participants from the study over time

questions.question: Why might qualitative research methods be useful in RCTs in Timor-Leste?
choices: They are cheaper to implement
They provide insights into mechanisms behind observed impacts
They eliminate the need for quantitative data
They are required by Timorese law
questions.answer: They provide insights into mechanisms behind observed impacts

questions.question: What is a key consideration when formulating research questions for RCTs in Timor-Leste?
choices: Ensuring they are as broad as possible
Focusing only on economic outcomes
Addressing pressing development challenges
Avoiding topics related to agriculture
questions.answer: Addressing pressing development challenges

questions.question: How can researchers navigate political sensitivities in Timor-Leste?
choices: By avoiding all politically relevant topics
By only working with government officials
By collaborating closely with local authorities and community leaders
By conducting research secretly
questions.answer: By collaborating closely with local authorities and community leaders

questions.question: What is a potential challenge of data collection in remote areas of Timor-Leste?
choices: Excessive internet connectivity
Too many trained researchers
Limited infrastructure
Overabundance of transportation options
questions.answer: Limited infrastructure

questions.question: Why is it important to consider seasonal variations when analyzing RCT results in Timor-Leste?
choices: Seasons don't exist in Timor-Leste
They can be potential confounding factors
They only affect urban areas
They are irrelevant to development outcomes
questions.answer: They can be potential confounding factors

questions.question: What is the purpose of stratification in RCT design?
choices: To increase the sample size
To eliminate the need for a control group
To ensure balance across important variables
To reduce the cost of the study
questions.answer: To ensure balance across important variables

questions.question: Why might mobile phone surveys be considered for data collection in Timor-Leste?
choices: Everyone in Timor-Leste owns a smartphone
They can overcome some infrastructure limitations
They are required by research ethics boards
They eliminate the need for in-person interviews
questions.answer: They can overcome some infrastructure limitations

questions.question: What is a key consideration when obtaining informed consent in Timor-Leste?
choices: Using only written forms
Explaining the study only in English
Considering collective decision-making in communities
Avoiding mention of potential risks
questions.answer: Considering collective decision-making in communities

questions.question: Why is it important to involve local researchers in RCTs in Timor-Leste?
choices: To reduce the cost of the study
To bypass ethical review processes
To build local research capacity
To avoid engaging with the community
questions.answer: To build local research capacity

questions.question: What is a potential benefit of conducting RCTs in Timor-Leste?
choices: Generating rigorous evidence for policymaking
Avoiding the need for ethical considerations
Guaranteeing positive outcomes for all interventions
Eliminating the need for further research
questions.answer: Generating rigorous evidence for policymaking

questions.question: Why might researchers need to be cautious about generalizing RCT results in Timor-Leste?
choices: RCTs always produce generalizable results
Timor-Leste's unique context may limit external validity
Generalization is not important in development economics
RCTs are not suitable for generalization
questions.answer: Timor-Leste's unique context may limit external validity

questions.question: What role can community leaders play in RCTs in Timor-Leste?
choices: They should be excluded to maintain objectivity
They can help with community engagement and trust-building
They should always be part of the treatment group
They are only relevant in urban settings
questions.answer: They can help with community engagement and trust-building

questions.question: Why is it important to consider traditional beliefs when designing health-related RCTs in Timor-Leste?
choices: Traditional beliefs are always more effective than modern medicine
They may influence health-seeking behaviors and intervention uptake
They are irrelevant to health outcomes
Considering them is unethical in scientific research
questions.answer: They may influence health-seeking behaviors and intervention uptake

questions.question: What is a potential challenge of using written surveys in rural Timor-Leste?
choices: Rural populations prefer longer surveys
Written surveys are always more accurate
Low literacy rates may affect comprehension and response
There is a paper shortage in rural areas
questions.answer: Low literacy rates may affect comprehension and response

questions.question: Why might researchers consider a phase-in design for RCTs in Timor-Leste?
choices: It's cheaper to implement
It allows for larger sample sizes
It addresses ethical concerns about withholding interventions
It eliminates the need for a control group
questions.answer: It addresses ethical concerns about withholding interventions

questions.question: What is an important consideration when designing agricultural interventions for RCTs in Timor-Leste?
choices: Focusing only on cash crops
Ignoring traditional farming practices
Considering seasonal variations and local agricultural cycles
Implementing identical interventions across all regions
questions.answer: Considering seasonal variations and local agricultural cycles

questions.question: Why is it crucial to secure data privacy in RCTs conducted in Timor-Leste?
choices: To comply with international research standards
To prevent other researchers from accessing the data
To hide negative results
Data privacy is not important in development research
questions.answer: To comply with international research standards
